overview_of_class: The seminar pertains to theories and empirical research concerning differences and similarities in the social behavior, traits, and abilities of women and men. Readings will consider theories of ultimate causes and proximal causes of sex differences. The seminar will study sociocultural and interactional processes, developmental processes, and the organizational and activational effects of hormones.
name: Topics in Social Psychology
title: WCAS PSYCH 489-0-20 Topics in Social Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The seminar pertains to theories and empirical research concerning differences and similarities in the social behavior, traits, and abilities of women and men. Readings will consider theories of ultimate causes and proximal causes of sex differences. The seminar will study sociocultural and interactional processes, developmental processes, and the organizational and activational effects of hormones.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Preparation in psychology sufficient to take graduate courses in the field; ordinarily, at least five courses in psychology and related fields.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation of one seminar paper and oral presentations.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Readings in the form of journal articles and books chapters will be posted at the seminar's Canvas site.

subject: PSYCH
